intro: Psiadia pollicina, commonly known as the small-leafed psiadia, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, aromatic stems and small, compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Psiadia pollicina is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to Mediterranean climates with hot, dry summers. It is not commonly cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological role.
